summary: Summaryfwee's Lip&Cheek Blurry Pudding Pot features a fluffy, filtered-effect formula that fills and blurs pores and fine lines. Super airy and lightweight for all-day comfort. Easily blendable and buildable with any tool for a smooth, soft-focus finish.
details: DetailsBenefitsDreamy Airbrushed Blush: A soft blurry finish delivers a smooth, seamless, natural flush of color to your cheek.A Little Goes a Long Way: Highly pigmented and buildable formula blends seamlessly. Suits every look from soft glam to everyday natural makeup.Pudding-like Texture: An all-new soft, bouncy pudding formula that has benefits of both cream blush and powder blush.Any Shade You Want: The wide color range categorized into different base shades and undertones (nude/coral/pink/red/mauve/rose).Key IngredientsTheobroma Cacao (Cocoa) Seed ButterAgave Tequilana Leaf ExtractFormulated WithoutPhthalatesParabensNonylphenol ethoxylatesTriclosanTriclocarbanHydroquinoneItem 2644022How To UseApply using fingertips or a brush onto your lips and cheeks.Precautions: 1. Stop using the product if redness, swelling, irritation, or rash occurs when skin is exposed to direct sunlight; if symptoms persist, consult a doctor. 2. Do not use on wounds or other infected areas. 3. Handling and storage; 1) Keep out of reach of children. 2) Keep out of direct sunlight.IngredientsDimethicone, Dimethicone Crosspolymer, Tribehenin, Diisostearyl Malate, Titanium Dioxide (CI 77891), Synthetic Fluorphlogopite, Polyglyceryl-2 Triisostearate, Cetyl PEG/PPG-10/1 Dimethicone, Sorbitan Isostearate, Vinyl Dimethicone/Methicone Silsesquioxane Crosspolymer, Polyhydroxystearic Acid, Iron Oxides (CI 77491), Lecithin, Red 33 Lake (CI 17200), Disteardimonium Hectorite, Iron Oxides (CI 77492), Paraffin, Ethylhexyl Palmitate, Isopropyl Myristate, Isostearic Acid, Yellow 5 Lake (CI 19140), Polyglyceryl-3 Polyricinoleate, Triethyl Citrate, Caprylyl Glycol, Fragrance(Parfum), Glyceryl Caprylate, Red 7 Lake (CI 15850), Microcrystalline Wax, Polyglyceryl-2 Diisostearate, Theobroma Cacao (Cocoa) Seed Butter, Butylene Glycol, Water, Agave Tequilana Leaf Extract
how_to_use: Apply using fingertips or a brush onto your lips and cheeks.Precautions: 1. Stop using the product if redness, swelling, irritation, or rash occurs when skin is exposed to direct sunlight; if symptoms persist, consult a doctor. 2. Do not use on wounds or other infected areas. 3. Handling and storage; 1) Keep out of reach of children. 2) Keep out of direct sunlight.

reviews.headline: Cute duo lip and cheek duo
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] The Fwee Lip&Cheek Blurry Pudding Pot is a playful and intriguing addition to any makeup collection. The compact pot already promises a multitasking vibe, merging lip color and cheek tint in a single, convenient product. The packaging is charmingly quirky, with a soft pastel aesthetic that feels both modern and whimsical. The texture is creamy yet lightweight, gliding smoothly onto lips and cheeks without dragging or pulling. On the lips, the shade delivers a comfortable, satin finish that looks natural and slightly juicy, never overly glossy. On the cheeks, the product blends out into a dewy flush that lifts the complexion with a healthy glow. The color payoff is buildable, allowing for sheer everyday polish or a deeper, statement look with more layers. The Blurry Pudding Pot excels at blending, thanks to its cushiony consistency that shears away harsh lines. It performs well across skin tones, offering versatility for fair to medium and deeper complexions with flattering warmth. The scent is subtle and sweet, enhancing the application experience without clashing with fragrance sensitivities. Longevity is reasonably good for a creamy hybrid, typically wearing several hours on lips with minimal feathering and a soft fade on cheeks. The formulation feels comfortable for extended wear, not drying out the lips or emphasizing fine lines. A key strength is its dual-use design, reducing clutter while encouraging a cohesive makeup look. The pigmentation on cheeks translates into a natural, sun-kissed glow that can be built up for more intensity. On lips, the color sits comfortably without settling into lip lines, maintaining a smooth surface. The creaminess helps it blur minor imperfections rather than accentuate them. The product is easy to apply straight from the pot or with fingers for a quick, low-effort routine. A small, precise dab goes a long way, making precise lip lining or blush placement unnecessary in many cases. The packaging is sturdy enough for travel, with a secure lid that travels well in a makeup bag. While some might prefer separate components for lips and cheeks, the blended versatility is precisely what makes this pot appealing. Overall, the Fwee Lip&Cheek Blurry Pudding Pot delivers a charming, multifunctional performance that's delightful to use and easy to incorporate into everyday looks.

reviews.headline: Beautiful color, but very drying. Needs a moisturizer.
reviews.comments:
[I received this product in exchange for my honest review] I had some really mixed feelings on Fwee lip & cheek Blurry Pudding Pot - ND04
Pros: 
It's adorable
Long-lasting, rich color
Cons:
Need to use a lip brush or I looked like I drew it on with crayons
Thought it would be glossy, but its definitely matte
Needed a moisturizer with it or it dried out my lips

reviews.headline: Natural glow!
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] I really like how light the texture is when applying and once it's on my cheeks. It gives a soft and natural glow that I love. I prefer using this over powder. I chose ND03 Without for color.

reviews.headline: Unique Lip & Cheek Blush!!
reviews.comments: I received this product in exchange for my honest review I was very excited to try this new Fwee Lip&Cheek Blurry Pudding Pot! I really like the packaging, pigment and blendability!! The texture is very fun and I like that it almost has no scent.

reviews.headline: A must have
reviews.comments: This is a very light almost powdery consistency when you apply it. Blends very effortlessly and gives you a pretty color with a little glow #complimentary #fwee #puddingpot #fweepuddingpot #blurrylip

reviews.headline: Great pigmentation
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] this product is great! It has nice pigmentation that isn't too strong and is great for an everyday look. The packaging is super cute, except there isn't as much product in there as it seems

reviews.headline: Double trouble lipstick üíÑ
reviews.comments:
[I received this product in exchange for my honest review] I wasn't sure what to expect from the Fwee Blurry Pudding Pot, but I'm genuinely impressed. As someone who loves the look of matte lipstick but hates how it dries my lips into a wrinkly mess, this product is a game-changer. The texture is unlike anything I've tried‚Äîit's fluffy, almost mousse-like, and surprisingly moisturizing. It gives that soft matte finish without the dreaded dryness or flakiness.
What really stands out is its versatility. Not only does it make my lips look smooth and blurred, but it also gives my cheeks a gorgeous, natural pop of color. It blends effortlessly and feels weightless on the skin. I love that I can toss one product in my bag and use it for both lips and cheeks‚Äîperfect for quick touch-ups or minimalist makeup days.
If you're looking for a multi-use product that delivers a matte look without compromising comfort, this little pot of pudding might just be your new favorite.

reviews.headline: Blendable and smells great!
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] This Blurry Pudding Pot is such a fun product! The packaging is so cute and portable, and the product itself has such a pleasant smell. It's blendable and builds easily on top of my foundation. I definitely recommend!

reviews.headline: Cute
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] This is such a cute idea. It can be used for so many things, and it is so portable. I do think it applies better with an applicator. The formula is also very good. It sits on my lips very well. I like how matte the product is as well.

reviews.headline: perfect duality product
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] the duality of this is perfect. packaging is so sleek and cute with a minimal scent provided. the pigmentation as well as the blend ability is perfect and the texture isn't sticky or annoying.

reviews.headline: A sweet throw back to matte mousse
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] You know, I wasn't sure if I was gonna like this color on me when I saw it. But a little bit goes a long way and I feel like it gave the perfect Sunkissed look. I also really liked it on my lips even though I really just use it on my top lip. But that's just something I like to do. I definitely would recommend it. And the texture was like an elevated Maybelline matte mousse, so that took me back. Also, goes on so easy with just the top of your finger. This will probably be a product I return to.

reviews.headline: Blurred flush and comfy on lips, but packaging isn't great
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] This Lip & Cheek Pot has a soft mousse texture that gives a blurred, matte look. On lips I like to top it with balm for extra comfort, and on cheeks it leaves a gentle, natural flush, perfect for no-makeup days with just sunscreen. I'm giving it 4/5 because the pot packaging is awkward to dip fingers into and the formula isn't particularly unique, though it's a reliable everyday product.

reviews.headline: Love this
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] Was so excited when I got the opportunity to try the pudding pot. And it did not disappoint. Love this color of me and it is is so fun to play with. Only thing I was surprised with it did not come with a stick.

reviews.headline: So beautiful!
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] This product is advertised as lip and cheek blurry pudding pot, however, I won't recommend it using on your lips, it just did not look good when i tried it as a lip product. However, it is absolutely lovely as a blush, I liked everything about it: the formula, the shade, it's long wearing, has a great pigment! My shade is "without", and it looks like light berry pink.  Also, it is blurring (it would be a great option for someone with larger pores like me), it has a soft and effortless finish, looks natural, but buildable. The formula is lightweight, and it blends really well, and it does have that filter effect. I'll consider buying different shades, I just wish it was in a tube to squeeze the product out instead of a pot.

reviews.headline: Subtle but buildable
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] I love this blush. I chose to use it for my cheeks and it's perfect. If you're looking for something subtle this is great. The texture is super cool and different. Like a mix between a powder and a cream. Goes on a cream and blends smooth like a powder. I love it. And this color also is perfect!

reviews.headline: Easy to apply
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] This lip and cheek blurry pudding pot has a cream like texture. It's pigmented to give that nice color blush on cheeks or tint on lips. Feels hydrating. It comes in a cute bottle

reviews.headline: Color didn't do it for me!!
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] The fwee lip&cheek Blurring pudding pot #ND04 called "My" is a soft rose shade that is very subtle. Its a fluffy mousse like texture with a matte finish, that can be buildable. It's versatile as it can be applied to the cheeks, as well to add some warnth. I love K-beauty skin care products, but honestly this lip product didn't do it for me. When applying I patted my lips inward, but a lip brush can also be used. I really couldn't tell I had it on my lips, as it gives a natural finish. Unfortunately it dryed out my lips, and a lip gloss applied on top would prevent them drying out. and it wouldn't dry out your lips. I didnt notice a blurry effect, but just nude stain to my lips. I don't think it's highly pigmented either. If your looking for a subtle shade for your cheeks, and a light stain for your lips I would recommend applying a nice lip gloss on top.

reviews.headline: Love this ! And yes , it actually does blur
reviews.comments: I was gifted for my review . This is my first time trying a pudding blush ! How fun is this ? The container is gorgeous with the frosted glass . The shade without is a light terracotta I'd say . Very wearable shade .  The texture is bouncy, like a bouncy whipped mousse .  It's super soft and feels like velvet on the skin. It feels like it turns to powder . It blends like a dream and can be built up . It didn't disturb my foundation or powder . It can be used on powder or cream . I can't wait to get the baby pink shade! Love this ! It could have come with an applicator though .

reviews.headline: Love this shade
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] What a fun product, this actually feels like pudding. The color is so amazing, would look great on anyone. I can't really identify any scent, works well mostly on cheeks, if used on lips I would apply a lip balm prior. Such an  adorable little pot, love the packaging.

reviews.headline: Amazing blurring pudding
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] The package is cute and little,  but I wear glasses and could not read the description or ingredients.  I would suggest white for the words it would be easier to read and not blend in with the peachy color of the box. Now with all that being said- this blurring pudding actually works very well and goes on super easy. It smells very lightly of a good lippy. The glass base that the pudding is in is absolutely beautiful.
